meanings.sent1: The old toy looked wanky with its missing parts.
meanings.sent2: The broken chair felt wanky when I sat on it.
meanings.sent3: The wanky sandwich I made was a sad attempt at lunch.
meanings.sent4: The wanky painting on the wall was an eyesore.
meanings.sent5: The wanky car sputtered and stalled on the road.

meanings.definition: (adverb) in a poor or unsatisfactory manner
meanings.sent1: She sang wanky during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The machine was functioning wanky after the repair.
meanings.sent3: He danced wanky, making everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: The clock ticked wanky, reminding me of its age.
meanings.sent5: The rain fell wanky, causing puddles to form.

meanings.definition: (verb) to behave in a pretentious or self-indulgent way
meanings.sent1: She always wankily flaunts her expensive jewelry.
meanings.sent2: He wankily showed off his new sports car to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat wankily paraded around with its toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The peacock wankily displayed its colorful feathers.
meanings.sent5: The child wankily demanded more toys at the store.
